Natalie couldn't even scream. She was too scared. She could see her brother and the others disappearing above her as darkness began to envelope her. She could hear rocks clattering around her, echoing through the chamber as she fell deeper into the abyss. Though, what really terrified her was the massive boulder above her that was hurtling downward at a tremendous speed. This was it. This was how she died. Even if the fall didn't kill her, the boulder would. She closed her eyes, bracing for her demise. She felt the wind knocked out of her as pain shot through her body and everything faded away.

"Natalie! Are you there? Natalie?! Natalie, say something!"

The voice sounded distant, coming to her through a pain filled darkness. Her whole body ached, though that might be a good thing. It meant she wasn't dead. The voice echoed around her, as she struggled to get her body to respond.

"Natalie?! Are you okay?"

That voice was different. A woman's voice. Still, it was familiar.

"Natalie! Come on, say anything! Please be okay!"

A third voice another man's voice. She recognized it, but she was having trouble thinking. Her head felt like it was full of cotton. Though, she could tell it was starting to clear.

"I'm... Okay... I think." she managed to say.

She opened her eyes as she tried to survey her surroundings. There was a little bit of light streaming in from what looked like a crack in the ceiling. She could see the boulder suspended above her. Numerous vines were holding it up, though it looked like it was blocking the hole she'd fell through. There were a few more vines on the ground around her. If she had to guess, they probably slowed her fall just enough to save her. And there must have been enough of them to catch the boulder.

Her eyes were slowly adjusting to the dim light as she looked around her landing spot. Her bag with all her supplies was dangling about 5 feet above her, caught on another vine. Though what was more impressive was the room she was in. It was a large room, that looked man-made. The floor was made of a smooth stone, and she could see several large columns supporting massive arches above her. On the far ends of the room she could see a couple of imposing doorways, though one of them looked to have been sealed by a previous rock slide.

"Are you okay, Natalie?" came her brother's voice from above.

"I think so." She yelled, feeling the aching in her body begin to subside, "I was caught by some vines, though I don't think I'll be able to get back out the way I came in."

"Like, you're not kidding. There's, like, no way we're going to be able to move that boulder." came the female voice of her brother's fiance.

"Even if we could, it would probably make the whole structure unstable." called her brother again.

"What do you see?" called her future brother-in-law.

"I think I found the ruins we were looking for. This room is massive. Though it looks like there's only one way for me to go." She could tell her strength was starting to return as she moved about the large room.

"Well, it seems like we're on an upper level of the ruins, though I don't know how we're going to get down to you." Her brother called.

"Well, I can start looking around down here and see if there's a way up deeper in. Though, I'm going to need to figure out how to get my bag first."

"Alright. Just be careful. There's another passage up here, so we're going to follow it and see if it leads down to you."

"Hey, before you go. Remind me what kind of ruins these are." Natalie called up to her brother.

"As far as my research can tell, it's a place where woman would come to become priestesses. There would be several trials they would have to go through before they could be an envoy to the gods. So, just be careful."

"Right, you too."

She sat on stone that had fallen, as she tried to finish recovering. After a few minutes, it grew completely silent from above her. Her ragged breathing seemed to fill the air, echoing around her in the stale air. It was obvious that no one had been hear in a long time, though this wasn't how she'd expected to enter. She still didn't know how the boulder that her rope was tied to had come loose. It was absolutely massive. It was almost like it had been trying to separate her from the others.

She closed her eyes as she focused on her breathing. She'd always been into meditation. It was just something she did when she was scared or angry. She didn't like being out of control of her emotions.

She took another deep breath. She may be separated from the others, but that didn't mean she was trapped. There was still that doorway at the far end of the room. Judging from what her brother said, there was a good possibility that there was another way out. If she was building a temple to put women through trials, she'd have one entrance they came in through, and another at the end that they could pass through when they were deemed worthy.

She could feel her heartbeat slowing as she took another breath. Still, she would need to figure out how to get her bag if she was going to continue deeper into the temple.

Slowly, she opened her eyes and scanned the room for anything that she could use. There were quite a few stones and boulders littering the room from the ceiling above. She could probably stack some and use them as a ladder to get to her bag. Though that would be dangerous if she fell. She could also probably use one of the vines on the ground like a whip to knock the bag loose. That would require quite a bit of dexterity though.

She bit her lip, looking for other options. It looked like one of the vines was looped around the vine that was holding her bag. She could either try to climb it, or use her weight to pull it down so she could reach her bag. Obviously, climbing would be risky if the vine gave way while she was still in the air. Though it wasn't like it was incredibly high. The bag itself had to be no more than ten or eleven feet off the ground.

The last option would be to just go on without the bag, though that was definitely not something she wanted to do. However, she felt she could if there was no other options.

Shaking your head, you wish you had a clue what the words meant. And the geometric shapes next to them make absolutely no sense to you. Are they traffic signs? Descriptions of what kind of rooms to expect? You have no clue.

"Hello?" you shout down each corridor, hoping to hear your brother answer back, but no response. With a sigh, you realize that you're just going to have to pick a corridor at random. You study the shapes by each word one more time and, on a hunch, decide to go

continue exploring your own body
152131212.content:
You decide to go to the left. The infinity symbol surrounded by two ellipses makes you think this is the way out. Since the infinity symbol is contained, that means you won't be wondering around forever, right?

Actually, you're pretty sure that's not what the symbol is trying to convey, but since you're absolutely clueless on what the words or the symbols mean, your guess is as good as any.

The corridor leads to a wide room, with polished mirrors along one wall. Considering how old these ruins are, the mirrors are in remarkably good shape.

As you step closer to the mirrors, they suddenly grow brighter and brighter, and you find yourself temporarily blinded. You also find yourself bathed in a comforting warmth. All the aches and pains in your body are disappearing.

When the light finally returns to normal, and you get your vision back, you gasp at the image in the mirror. All the cuts and bruising are gone, and you look, for lack of a better word, "freshly pressed." All your clothes look as clean and as unworn as the day you bought them.

Well, almost all of your clothes. Your shirt and bra are in shreds, but that's understandable. To paraphrase Dr. Seuss, your breasts have grown three sizes that day.

You stare in wonder at the image of your new breasts, the size of cantaloupes, hanging off your chest. The look almost unnaturally firm, riding high on your chest. You actually giggle at your mental use of the word 'unnaturally.' Whatever happened that replaced your A-cup breasts with these larger versions certainly couldn't be considered 'natural.'

You marvel at the slight jiggle your new breasts make as you laugh. They remind you of the pair your soon to be sister-in-law sports. You never said it to anyone, and you love her to death, but you've always envied her larger breasts. In many ways, you two are identical. She's a blonder, fairer skinned version of you, with an athletic build, flat (but not defined) stomach, tight ass, slightly narrow hips, and long hair that reaches down to her waist, just like yours. But where you were almost flat-chested, she had been blessed with D-Cup beauties.

Which you seem to have now too.

You spin around to check out your body, and there had been no other changes. Same toned body, same height, same hair (though now smelling freshly shampooed), same tight butt, same slightly narrowish hips. The only thing different are these new breasts of yours.

You almost timidly cup your own breasts, and make a little "mmmmm" when your fingers touch your skin. Your breasts aren't overly sensitive, but they do feel just a tad more sensitive than they used to. Your nipples (which did not change in size) grow hard from a combination of exposure to the air and your self-examination. Your fingers gently glide up and over them, which sends a little thrill through your body. Again, they have not grown overly sensitive, but they do feel just a little more sensitive before. You idly wonder what it would feel like to have someone else's hands on your breasts and nipples, since no other hands have ever been on them except yours, even before the grew.

15213121211.content:
The same lightly glowing line the walls as you ascend the stairs. The stairs are narrow...not too narrow, plenty of room to climb, but no one could squeeze past you, especially now that you're sporting D-Cup breasts.

You ascend to where you hope is about the level you fell of the cliff at. The stairs emerge into a large room void of any markings, save for the omnipresent glowing fungus lining the walls.

There are two openings on the opposite sides of the rooms.

As you ponder which opening to go through, you hear your brother start to call you.

"Natalie?" his voice echoes from the opening on the left.

"Steve?" you yell back, rushing to the left entrance.

"Oh Natalie," Lindsay, Steve's fiancée, "We're so glad we found you." Her voice sounds like it's coming from the other tunnel opening. "The tunnels down here, it's like a maze."

Confused, you run to the opening of the other tunnel. "Did you guys split up or something to look for me?"

"No," Lindsay answers, this time her voice emerges from the first tunnel. "Well, Rob (Lindsay's brother) twisted his ankle almost as soon as we entered the tunnels, so he went back to camp. But Steve and I have stayed within reaching distance of each other ever since. And taking copious notes. There ruins are amazing. And easy to get lost in, if you're not paying attention."

As the conversation continues, the voices of your brother and his future wife alternate from which tunnel they appear to be coming from. You tell your brother and Lindsay what's happening, but neither one of them has an explanation why.

"Just stay put, Natalie," your brother advises you. "We'll be there in a second."

You answer "Okay," then sit down and lean back against a wall, getting comfortable.

After about fifteen minutes, Steve and Lindsay don't show up. Not only do they not show up, they no longer answer your shouts. Worried, you decide to stay put for a little while longer. After all, the acoustics in this place are pretty weird to say the least.

After another fifteen minutes, Steve and Lindsay still don't show up, and still don't answer your shouts.

1523.content:
"Natalie?" your brother's voice says on the phone. Even though you two just had a shouting exchange a few minutes ago, you're still happy to hear his voice.

"Yeah," you tell him, "I got my bag and dug out the satellite phone."

"Well, once we descend down into the tunnels, we won't be able to get a hold of each other." Your brother pauses, then says, "I tell you what. I'm going to have Rob (your future brother-in-law) go back to the base camp. There's a spare satellite phone there. And anytime one of us gets to any point where we've got open sky above us, we'll give him a call. He can relay messages between us. Which hopefully won't be necessary, since I'm hoping we'll run into each other soon."

"That...is an excellent plan," you say with a sigh of relief.

"So how're you doing down there?" a feminine voice says. You smile at the sound of your brother's future wife.

"Banged up but still moving," you say with a wan smile.

"Well, get yourself cleaned up with your first aid kid," your brother tells you. "We'll see you soon, Natalie."

As the conversation ends, you feel your spirits lifted. You get your first aid kit out, clean yourself up, take a couple of healthy swallows from your water bottle, and even eat an energy bar. You tie up your hair in a loose ponytail and get ready to move forward.

info.brief_description: Can you escape the ancient ruins, or forever be changed by them
info.description:
Natalie had always been on the athletic side her whole life. It probably had something to do with the fact that she'd loved going on adventures ever since she was little. Her older brother had always been into ancient civilizations and had gone to school to study them. He'd often take her on his expeditions. This had started as just another expedition deep into the forest in search of some ancient ruins, but it was going to change Natalie for the rest of her life.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I've done a lot of stories that mostly seem to have the same basic plot, and while this is still supposed to be an erotic adventure, I thought that I'd do something a little different with this one. I've always been interested in creating a game around the fetishes that I write about, but have never really had the time. So I'm going to treat this similar to a game. Natalie, will have different stats that will change depending on the readers choices. Think of this more as a puzzle than just a story where you watch the main character change. As Natalie changes, there may be some options that will fail and not go the way she expects. However, as she changes, some other options may become more viable. Will she give into the trials of the ruins, or will she resist their ability to change her?
